title: Customer Lifetime Value and the Value of Recovery
summary: This page discusses the impact of failed credit card payments on customer lifetime value (LTV) and revenue for subscription businesses. It highlights how lost revenue from failed payments can significantly hinder profitability and customer acquisition cost (CAC) recovery, emphasizing the importance of effective failed payment recovery solutions.
key_points: Failed payments are a major barrier to revenue growth in subscription businesses.
Customer Lifetime Value (LTV) is the true cost of a lost customer due to premature churn.
Effective failed payment recovery solutions are crucial for retaining customers and maximizing LTV.
LTV should ideally be at least three times higher than Customer Acquisition Cost (CAC).
